poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Papes and other blighters scoffing haddock or plaice and chips It being Friday. There's aye one shouting the odds Another mutters and prates full time, his pate's Away with it. The foreman plater plates and having Had his chips clocks in to wife and weans, the weeest Being my dad. Somewhere in Renfrew. All gone. Who paints the woodwork? Does anyone lodge complaints About the bigots? I'd have thought not. The plates I guess are delft; I mind That word from way back. How did the place Smell? Hard work and prayer? Or reeking damp? Pace yourselves, people: hard times ahead.
